Chinese.title: Kung Pao Chicken
ingredients: Salt and white pepper to taste
Chinese.instructions: Marinate chicken with soy sauce, Shaoxing wine, and cornstarch for 20 minutes. Heat oil in a wok over high heat. Add chili peppers and stir-fry for 30 seconds until fragrant. Add chicken and stir-fry for 3-4 minutes until golden. Add garlic and ginger, stir-fry for 1 minute. Add peanuts and green onions, stir-fry for 1 minute. Add hoisin sauce, rice vinegar, sesame oil, and Sichuan peppercorns. Stir-fry for 1 minute until sauce thickens. Season with salt and white pepper. Serve hot with steamed rice.

Chinese.title: Mapo Tofu
ingredients: 1 tablespoon cornstarch mixed with 2 tablespoons water
Chinese.instructions: Heat oil in a wok over medium heat. Add ground pork and stir-fry until browned, about 3 minutes. Add doubanjiang and stir-fry for 1 minute. Add garlic and ginger, stir-fry for 30 seconds. Add soy sauce, Shaoxing wine, and Sichuan peppercorns. Add chicken stock and bring to simmer. Gently add tofu cubes and simmer for 3-4 minutes. Add cornstarch mixture and stir gently until sauce thickens. Add green onions and sesame oil. Season with salt if needed. Serve hot with steamed rice.

Chinese.title: Peking Duck
Chinese.instructions: Clean and dry duck thoroughly. Mix honey, soy sauce, Shaoxing wine, five-spice powder, and salt. Rub mixture all over duck, inside and out. Hang duck in a cool, dry place for 24 hours to dry skin. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Place duck on a rack in a roasting pan. Roast for 1 hour, then increase temperature to 400°F (200°C) and roast for additional 30 minutes until skin is crispy and golden. Let rest for 15 minutes. Carve duck into thin slices. Serve with pancakes, cucumber, green onions, and hoisin sauce.

Chinese.title: Dim Sum Har Gow
Chinese.instructions: Chop shrimp into small pieces. Mix with bamboo shoots, soy sauce, sesame oil, white pepper, and sugar. Refrigerate for 30 minutes. Mix wheat starch, tapioca starch, and salt. Add boiling water and stir until dough forms. Knead for 5 minutes until smooth. Divide into 20 pieces. Roll each piece into thin circles. Place 1 tablespoon filling in center of each wrapper. Fold edges to form pleats and seal. Steam in bamboo steamer for 8-10 minutes until translucent. Serve hot with soy sauce and chili oil.

Chinese.title: Hot and Sour Soup
ingredients: 1 tablespoon cornstarch mixed with 2 tablespoons water
Chinese.instructions: Bring chicken stock to boil in a large pot. Add tofu, bamboo shoots, wood ear mushrooms, and lily flowers. Simmer for 5 minutes. Add soy sauce, rice vinegar, chili oil, and white pepper. Stir in cornstarch mixture and simmer until soup thickens slightly. Slowly drizzle beaten eggs into soup while stirring gently to form ribbons. Add green onions and season with salt. Serve hot.

Japanese.title: Sushi Nigiri
Japanese.instructions: Rinse rice until water runs clear. Cook rice with water in a rice cooker or on stovetop. Mix rice vinegar, sugar, and salt until dissolved. Fold vinegar mixture into hot rice. Let rice cool to room temperature. Wet hands with water and vinegar. Take a small amount of rice and form into oval shape. Place a small amount of wasabi on rice. Top with fish slice and press gently to adhere. Repeat with different fish. Serve with soy sauce and pickled ginger.

Japanese.title: Tonkatsu
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
Japanese.instructions: Season pork cutlets with salt and pepper. Dredge in flour, then dip in beaten eggs, then coat with panko breadcrumbs. Heat oil to 350°F (175°C). Fry cutlets for 3-4 minutes per side until golden brown and crispy. Drain on paper towels. Mix tonkatsu sauce, soy sauce, mirin, and sugar. Slice cutlets and serve with shredded cabbage and sauce.

Japanese.title: Ramen
Japanese.instructions: Bring chicken stock to boil. Add soy sauce, mirin, and sake. Simmer for 10 minutes. Cook ramen noodles according to package directions. Drain and divide among 4 bowls. Ladle hot broth over noodles. Top with soft-boiled eggs, chashu pork, nori, green onions, bean sprouts, and corn. Drizzle with sesame oil and serve hot.

Japanese.title: Tempura
Japanese.instructions: Heat oil to 350°F (175°C). Mix flour, ice-cold water, and egg yolk to make tempura batter. Dip shrimp and vegetables in batter. Fry in hot oil for 2-3 minutes until golden and crispy. Drain on paper towels. Mix dashi stock, soy sauce, mirin, and sake for dipping sauce. Serve tempura hot with dipping sauce.

Japanese.title: Miso Soup
Japanese.instructions: Bring dashi stock to simmer. Add tofu and wakame seaweed. Simmer for 2 minutes. Dissolve miso paste in a small amount of hot stock, then add to soup. Add green onions and nori. Season with mirin and salt if needed. Serve hot.

Thai.title: Pad Thai
Thai.instructions: Soak rice noodles in warm water for 30 minutes. Heat oil in a wok over high heat. Add garlic and stir-fry for 30 seconds. Add shrimp and tofu, stir-fry for 2 minutes. Push ingredients to one side and scramble eggs in the other side. Add noodles, fish sauce, tamarind paste, and palm sugar. Stir-fry for 2-3 minutes. Add green onions and bean sprouts, stir-fry for 1 minute. Garnish with peanuts, lime wedges, and cilantro. Serve hot.

Thai.title: Tom Yum Goong
Thai.instructions: Bring chicken stock to boil. Add lemongrass, kaffir lime leaves, chilies, garlic, and galangal. Simmer for 10 minutes. Add shrimp and mushrooms, cook for 3-4 minutes until shrimp turn pink. Add fish sauce, lime juice, and chili paste. Garnish with green onions and cilantro. Serve hot.

Thai.title: Green Curry
Thai.instructions: Heat coconut milk in a large pot. Add green curry paste and stir-fry for 2 minutes until fragrant. Add chicken and cook for 3-4 minutes. Add eggplants, bamboo shoots, kaffir lime leaves, fish sauce, and palm sugar. Simmer for 10-15 minutes until chicken is cooked and vegetables are tender. Add Thai basil and chilies. Garnish with green onions and cilantro. Serve hot with steamed rice.

Thai.title: Som Tam
Thai.instructions: In a mortar and pestle, pound chilies and garlic until crushed. Add fish sauce, lime juice, and palm sugar, mix well. Add shredded papaya and tomatoes. Pound gently to combine. Add peanuts and dried shrimp. Toss well. Garnish with green onions and cilantro. Serve immediately.

Thai.title: Mango Sticky Rice
Thai.instructions: Soak glutinous rice in water for 4 hours or overnight. Drain rice and steam for 20 minutes until tender. In a saucepan, heat coconut milk, sugar, and salt until sugar dissolves. Pour over hot rice and let absorb for 30 minutes. Arrange mango slices on serving plates. Top with sticky rice. Drizzle with coconut cream and sprinkle with sesame seeds. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Korean.title: Bibimbap
Korean.instructions: Marinate beef with soy sauce, sugar, and sesame oil for 30 minutes. Cook each vegetable separately in a little oil until tender. Cook beef until browned. Fry eggs sunny-side up. Arrange rice in bowls. Top with vegetables, beef, and egg in sections. Add gochujang and sesame oil. Mix well before eating.

Korean.title: Bulgogi
Korean.instructions: Mix soy sauce, sugar, sesame oil, rice wine, garlic, ginger, green onions, sesame seeds, and black pepper. Marinate beef in mixture for 2 hours or overnight. Heat a large skillet over high heat. Cook beef in batches until browned and caramelized, about 2-3 minutes per batch. Serve hot with steamed rice and lettuce wraps.

Korean.title: Kimchi Jjigae
Korean.instructions: Heat sesame oil in a large pot. Add pork belly and cook until browned. Add kimchi and stir-fry for 2 minutes. Add onion and garlic, cook for 2 minutes. Add gochugaru, kimchi juice, and water. Bring to boil, then simmer for 20 minutes. Add tofu and green onions. Simmer for 5 minutes. Season with salt if needed. Serve hot with steamed rice.

Korean.title: Japchae
Korean.instructions: Cook noodles according to package directions. Drain and rinse with cold water. Marinate beef with soy sauce, sugar, and sesame oil for 30 minutes. Cook each vegetable separately in a little oil until tender. Cook beef until browned. Mix all ingredients together. Season with additional soy sauce, sesame oil, and black pepper. Garnish with sesame seeds. Serve at room temperature.

Korean.title: Tteokbokki
Korean.instructions: Soak rice cakes in warm water for 30 minutes. In a large pot, combine water, gochujang, gochugaru, soy sauce, sugar, and garlic. Bring to boil. Add rice cakes and fish cakes. Simmer for 10-15 minutes until rice cakes are tender and sauce thickens. Add green onions and sesame oil. Garnish with sesame seeds. Serve hot.
